intro: Centrocarpha discolor, commonly known as the pale coneflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branching. The flowers are yellow in color, with a distinctive white to pale yellow center, making it a striking addition to native gardens.
